about_the_game:
Warning: Game under development!

- What's the game about?


We created this game for you and your friends!

The main point of this game is to have fun and enjoyable time, you can play with your friends or find new ones. During the game, participants answer questions of varying value, trying to get ahead of your opponent and collect points, whoever has more points is the winner.

- How does it work?


Questions can be a variety of formats: Video, photo, text, music. The game consists of at least several main rounds and a final round. Each of the main rounds contains questions on a category of different format.

-Themes and categories for every taste!


You can choose the theme of the game questions (such as music, movies, books, etc.) you can find by category filters in our browser for every taste and color. These packages work via the Steam workshop, which means that all the functionality of the workshop is at your disposal.

-Show Your Uniqueness!


If you can not find the theme that suits you, we have developed for you a convenient and detailed designer! You will have the opportunity to design your own unique rounds, categories and questions. You can create unique questions based on video, photo, text and music of your choice. Once you create your own package, it can be added to Steam workshop.

-Even more fun and diversity!


In order to diversify your gameplay and engage you even more in addition to the classic mode, we also plan to add a unique.
Unique modes will be in a certain style such as poker or soccer with their own unique mechanics and gameplay.

You can chat and find company for the game in our Discord

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS *: Windows 7 64bit
  • Processor: Intel Pentium 4 processor or later that's SSE2 capable
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • DirectX: Version 10
  • Storage: 10 GB available space

short_description: Answenarium is a free quiz game where you can have fun answering funny or smart questions with your friends. Everyone will find here something to their liking. And if you don’t find it, you can make your own set of questions.
